participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Reflective and nostalgic, enjoys sharing personal experiences and values connections.
participant_1.background: I listen to the music of my youth to feel like a kid again. I have never been on an airplane. My cooking skills are better than my singing skills. I want a home that is safe and comfortable for my family. Comic Con is not my thing.

participant_2.name: Michael
participant_2.personality: Thoughtful and family-oriented, values memories and has a strong sense of nostalgia.
participant_2.background: I have a house with a large yard for my paps to hunt mushrooms. My wife works as a diesel mechanic. My work schedule is hectic and I have trouble staying in touch with my family. I never knew my dad. I have a journal that I've been writing in since I was a teenager.

content.text: What's your favorite genre of music? I love listening to the music of my youth, it makes me feel like a kid again.
I like listening to music from the 70's and 80's. My dad was a big music fan and he used to play music from those eras all the time when I was a kid.
Oh that's cool! My dad wasn't really into music so I had to find my own way.
I'm sorry to hear that. Music is such a great way to connect with people.
I agree! It's one of the things that I love most about it.
What's your favorite song from the 70's or 80's?
That's a tough question. I have so many favorites. But I think I would have to say "Don't Stop Believing" by Journey.
Oh that's a great song! I love Journey.
Me too! They're one of my favorite bands.
I'm glad we have something in common.
